data.title: Disappointed we could not take photos
data.text: House has been beautifully and period restored but as we were not allowed to take photos it lost some appeal.

data.title: Wonderful house
data.text: We were all impressed by this beautiful house.  After ringing the doorbell we were welcomed in and given an overview by a knowledgeable member of staff who then sent us on our way as the tour is self-guided.  There are photographs of all the Governors who have lived in the house and upstairs there are also photos of their wives.  Different areas are set in different time periods which really gave a feeling of how the different families had lived in the house.  I loved the sun room, which had apparantly originally been open but has now been closed in but is still very pleasant. As a child born in the 1950's I also enjoyed the room of one of the daughters which was obviously her shrine to The Beatles.  Also the attic space where the children used to act out plays and performances.  In the basement there is an apartment where former staff lived, and a still stocked fallout shelter.  Highly recommended.

data.title: Great stop on the city visit
data.text: We stopped here before departing Cheyenne and appreciated the informative brochure with self-guided tour.

data.title: A nice enough house tour, but not a must see
data.text:
We toured the house using the self-guiding tour sheet.  It's fairly interesting - and there was no admission fee.

We didn't find the house or the info learned from the tour to be remarkably impressive.  If you want to immerse yourself in Cheyenne history/heritage, visit the house.  If you're an out of town tourist short on time, there are probably more memorable ways to spend your time.

data.title: Absolutely lovely house, well worth a visit.
data.text:
We came upon this by loosely following a walking trail round town on Labor Day weekend Sunday. The town was deserted really, streets very quiet.
It turned out to be a real gem, a beautiful family home and it's a self guided tour. Lots of rooms to visit and it's FREE too! 
There are photos of all the Governors who have lived there and the various changes they made during their stay. There is a fall out shelter in the basement which was interesting, still all stocked up!
I really loved the sun room upstairs.

data.title: Very Educational
data.text: Loved seeing this place.  Well worth the 30-45 mins spent there.  Also don't forget to call the number on the signs and hear the audio tour at each room.  They send you a discount code for the State Museum gift shop that has super cute stuff to buy in it!

data.title: Interesting building
data.text: My husband and I were going to go to the Cheyenne Frontier Days but decided to take in some of Cheyenne's history.  This historic building is very interesting and has alot of history.  We even learned that some of the past and the present governor's didn't and don't live in the mansion like the Colorado governor does.

data.title: Ring the bell & come on in!
data.text: If you're visiting Cheyenne, you should tour the governor's mansion! We loved the sign at the front door: ring the bell & come in! This free tour begins with a brief history of the governors & the mansion by your host. Then you are invited to take a self-guided tour of the three story mansion at your own pace. Lots of tidbits, history & period pieces in the mansion.

data.title: Stunning!
data.text: I'm always one for old historical mansions, and this one does not disappoint! The woman who guided us through most of the mansion provided a nice narrative to the families that lived in the home over time. The crews who restored the home in the early 2000s did a spectacular job keeping up with the history of the time periods. Would love to come back and see it again. A definite do not miss!!

data.title: Where Governors Gathered
data.text: What great fun to visit! Even though the home was occupied for several decades by a number of different families, the interpretation manages to tell a coherent story. Love the fallout shelter (great way to talk about the Cold War years and what it meant to be located near a Intercontinental Ballistic missile base).

data.title: Old is good
data.text: If you like going back in time it is very well done and interesting to see how people lived during that time and what they thought was important. A fallout shelter really!?

data.title: A gem
data.text: I love home tours.  This one really surprised me.  This grand Mansion is located on a quiet residential street.  You could almost miss it if you weren't looking for it.  The Mansion has been beautifully restored.  One nice feature is that several rooms are decorated from different periods of use.  So you can really get an idea of how the mansion evolved.  They played period music in each room which was a great addition.  Aside from it's outward beauty, the Mansion is full of surprises. My favorite was the fallout shelter.  I also loved the kitchen which has been decorated in vintage 1950's style.  The mansion is homey and grand at the same time.  The docents were very helpful and informative.  I highly recommend a visit.

data.title: Beautiful property
data.text: Just a block from the state Capitol. Street parking surrounding.  It has been fully restored.   The tour is not very long, but worth it.  Outside to the right is a brick pathway of all of the governors and First Lady families of Wyoming.

data.title: HISTORY OF WYOMING'S GOVERNORS
data.text: A beautiful old building now restored to its original splendor. Period furniture and displays throughout the 3 floors. The onsite curator is a charming warm hostess who is extremely helpful. It was interesting to see how the various governors and wives lived.

data.title: Governors mansion Mother's Day brunch!
data.text: I took my mother, grandmother, and a very close friend of the family to the Mother's Day brunch. We all had so much fun and were so amazed by it. It was great!!! We came from Scottsbluff to go to the brunch and I am so glad we did. The food was delicious, the staff was AMAZING, the tea setting was beautiful, the house was gorgeous! You made it the best Mother's Day ever for all these mothers! :) Thank you again so very much!! :) We will definitely be back!

data.title: Lovely trip back in time
data.text: Great for adults but you would be hard pressed keeping the kids interested. Have been visiting Wyoming for six years and had never visited until I read a review; check opening times as it changes with the season.

data.title: it was a fun walk thru.
data.text: it was tight with the high traffic, but cool all in all. WE attended for the 125 anniversary of Wyoming be a state. IT was a fun time.

data.title: Great place
data.text: Great place to visit if you want to see a cool place this it the place don't miss it take the time to go and see

data.title: Glad It Was Included in Trolley Tour
data.text: Visiting here was part of the trolley trip we took.  Glad it was.  Beautiful period house.  I love wandering around any of these old mansions.  It was really cool to see some of the "behind the scenes" rooms in this one, i.e. the fallout shelter with the supplies in case of nuclear attack and the old-style laundry room with wringer washers.

data.title: Step back in time
data.text: Stop by if you find your self in Cheyenne, WY.  This is a great step back in time, and a glimpse of Cheyenne, WY, history.
